alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 2:56AM MST until May 17 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A DAM RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY, MAY 23... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Arizona, including the following county, Yuma. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST Tuesday May 23. * IMPACTS...Lowland flooding and inundation of unbridged crossings will occur along the Gila River downstream of Painted Rock Dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 252 AM MST, water being released from Painted Rock Dam is traveling through Yuma County, with a USGS gauge in Dateland indicating flows at 8.9 feet, which is near minor flood stage (9 feet). These elevated flows will continue to flood unbridged river crossings and may inundate some farmland. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paloma and Roll. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
